column1: Little Goat Diner////Just had an awesome breakfast here (at noon). I sat at the counter so I got to peep all the dishes as they came to the pass. Everything
column2: but especially the fish tostadas which everyone seemed to order
column3: looked amazing. On the first of what will be many visits I had the Bull's Eye French Toast. The bull's eye being a sunny side up egg cooked in the center of each sweet onion brioche slab of French toast. It's served up with fried chicken
column5: and gooseberries which serve wonderfully to cut the richness of the dish. For dessert I had the smoked pork and toffee shake. Unbelievably savory and delicious Can't wait to return for lunch to try some of those amazing looking sammiches
